events.name: Code, Coffee and Lemonade
events.description:
Pitești

Este cunoscut faptul că programatorii transformă cafeaua în cod, dar este vară și o limonadă cu gheață și mentă face minuni.

Așadar vă invităm la o întâlnire informală, ”Code, Coffee and Lemonade” marca GDG Pitești, Joi, 11 august, ora 19:00 la Zeta Terrace & Lounge situat la etajul 2, din Trivale Shopping Center.

Pentru a organiza lucrurile și pentru că locurile sunt limitate vă rugăm să completați acest formular: https://goo.gl/forms/bseboVbU8shgZXgF2

GDG Pitești face cinste cu limonada! ;)

Do you want to meet other Google developers like you? Are you looking to get a chance to work on some of your own code? Do you want to share your ideas for our next meetups?

Then come join us for “Code, Coffee and Lemonade”, an informal afternoon get-together outside of the regular GDG Pitesti meetings to give you a chance to get to know each other better and end the day on the right foot! There is no agenda for “Code, Coffee and Lemonade” so feel free to pop in, even just for a few minutes, just to say hello, or plan to stay a while longer if you'd like. Just bring yourself and enjoy!

GDG Pitești offers the lemonade! ;)

events.name: Boost your digital knowledge
events.description:
Boost your digital knowledge

Atelierul Digital in Romania provides free digital skills training for students, employers and business owners through an online platform, as well as face-to-face trainings in different cities across the country.

You should invest several hours, September 16th, in order to get an intro to various things like how to build, optimise and promote a website, SEO, SEM, social media, email marketing, web analytics and much more.

Register for free <a>here</a> and search for Atelierul Digital Pitesti.

Revenim cu agenda și rockstar speakers  :)

events.name: Firebase Christmas Codelab
events.description:
In summer we received feedback from the GDG Pitesti community members and on the list of the next topics to cover on our events was Firebase.

So GDG Pitesti will close the year with an awesome Firebase Christmas Lab. This codelab is designed to help the community developers learn about using Firebase.

And because this meetup is near Christmas, and Christmas is a time when family and friends come together and remember the good things they have, we will sing carols and we will spread some joy! :)

AGENDA

➡️ "Project M – Scaling Agile Case Study", Laurentiu Bold, Development Consultant at Endava
➡️ "Java Puzzlers, just a few traps, pitfalls and dark corners", Daniel Ghita, Senior Developer at Endava
➡️ "Firebase Web Codelab" facilitated by Alin Miu and Magda Miu

Register here!

events.name: Next ’17 Extended - GDG Pitesti
events.description:
On March 8-10, the Cloud Next event took place in San Francisco. It was an event that brought together developers, executives, customers, partners, IT decision makers, and Google engineers to build the future of the cloud. Attendees saw what's coming from the Google Cloud Platform, G Suite, Maps, and Devices teams.

You don’t have to be in San Francisco to be part of history! Join our event "Next ’17 Extended - GDG Pitesti" on March 31st, starting from 18:30, at Ramada Pitesti, Opal Conference Room

Register here for free: https://goo.gl/forms/hDxaLrMxW71mz6cB2

#GoogleNext17 #extended

events.name: VR Jam at Dracula's Castle
events.description:
Developers, hackers, enthusiasts, artists and engineers are invited to work with each other, create, learn and explore Virtual Reality, Augmented Reality and 360 Video applications at our first VR event: VR Jam at Dracula’s Castle. We hope you would join us on the weekend of July 21-23 in Bran so we can envision historic, educational and touristic immersive experiences together and make them a reality.

The event is organised by GDG Bucharest, Google Developer Group Pitești - GDG Pitești and Realities, the Romanian VR & AR Think Tank

events.name: Kotlin Night Pitesti
events.description:
Kotlin is a statically typed programming language for modern multiplatform applications. 100% interoperable with Java™ and Android™ and now it's official on Android. 

At Google I/O 2017, the Android team announced first-class support for Kotlin. 

For Android developers, Kotlin support is a chance to use a modern and powerful language, helping solve common headaches such as runtime exceptions and source code verbosity. Kotlin is easy to get started with and can be gradually introduced into existing projects, which means that your existing skills and technology investments are preserved.

Starting now, Android Studio 3.0 ships with Kotlin out of the box, meaning Android developers no longer need to install any extras or worry about compatibility. It also means that moving forward, you can rest assured that both JetBrains and Google will be supporting Android development in Kotlin.

At Kotlin Night Pitesti we will learn about the capabilities of the Kotlin language.

The agenda:

1. Intro to Kotlin

2. What is fun in Kotlin?

The speakers are Magda Miu and Alin Miu.

It will be a fun experience and we will have also swags offered by our sponsor for this event: JetBrains. 

Register here for free: https://goo.gl/forms/cs0pkYFuKMcs5bUn1

See you at the event! :)

events.name: Firebase Meetup with a Googler
events.description:
Join us to learn how Firebase helps mobile app teams of all sizes across the entire development lifecycle, from building your app, to improving app quality, to growing your business. You’ll also get the opportunity to ask questions and give feedback directly to a team member from Google that builds Firebase.

📒 AGENDA:
✅ 19:00 - 19:05 Opening from the community organisers
✅ 19:05 - 19:35 Magda Miu | Android Technical Lead at Roweb | Using Java to interact with Firebase in Android
✅ 19:35 - 20:20 Jon Mensing | Product Manager at Google | Running and Growing live apps with Firebase
✅ 20:20 - 21:00 Networking

👨🏻‍💻 Jon Mensing

📌Presentation title:
Running and Growing live apps with Firebase

📃 Abstract:
You may be familiar with Firebase as a realtime database in the Cloud, but it's much, much more. In this session we'll discuss how Firebase can be used to improve your live app's quality, manage feature rollouts, perform A/B tests, send notifications, and more.

🚀Bio:
Jon Mensing is a Product Manager at Google who focuses on messaging and testing features within Firebase. His past experience includes work at BuzzFeed and Zynga. Jon has an MBA from Wharton, a Master of Public Policy degree from the Harvard Kennedy School, and a B.S. in Computer Science from the U.S. Air Force Academy.

👨🏻‍💻 Magda Miu

📌Presentation title:
Using Java to interact with Firebase in Android

📃 Abstract:
Firebase is a platform used to build better apps, improve their quality and also to grow businesses.
This talk will cover examples about how to create a new project in Firebase console, how to integrate Google sign-in in the Java code in Android, how to save and get data from Cloud Firestore and how to use Cloud Messaging. Finally we will review the advantages of using Firebase Crashlytics that help us, the developers, to never miss a critical crash.

🚀Bio:
Magda is an enthusiastic and innovative Mobile Team Leader and Certified Scrum Master with more than 7 years experience in software development. She is also co-organiser at Google Developers Group Pitesti and Women Techmakers Romania.

P.S.: only 70 seats available
events.how_to_find_us: Strada Ion Constantin Bratianu 48-52, Pitești 110110, Romania (Centru Afaceri Pitesti)

events.name: IWD 2019 by Women Techmakers Romania & GDG Pitesti
events.description:
International Women's Day (IWD) is marked on March 8th every year. In different regions, the focus of celebrations ranges from general respect and appreciation toward women to a celebration of women's economic, political, and social achievements.

AGENDA:
19:00 - 19:05 | Intro about WTM Romania
19:05 - 19:35 | "Let’s talk Product", Raluca Pantiru
19:35 - 19:45 | "Know your persona and the rest will follow", Anca Sandu
19:45 - 20:15 | "Innovation Labs - the backstage story", Flavia Husar

👩‍💻 Raluca Pantiru, Product Manager @ Fitbit

📃 Bio:
Raluca is a product person, passionate about wellness and innovative products, with a fondness for direct interaction with users.
At Fitbit, she has been involved in long-term strategy, execution, launch and product direction for new markets and segments, for both software and hardware products.
Raluca and her team launched Fitbit Ace, Fitbit's first activity tracker for kids, as well as the Family Account, a feature within the Fitbit app, that allows the whole family to support each other on their health journey.
Raluca started off her career in the Consumer Products Industry back in 2016, in Marketing, when she joined Vector Watch, the Romanian startup that created the “affordable luxury” smartwatch with a 30-day battery life. Vector Watch was acquired by Fitbit the same year.
Previous to Vector Watch, she worked as a law consultant.
Raluca loves flat whites and airports.

👩‍💻 Anca Sandu, Product Manager

📃 Bio:
Anca chose to leave the corporate life after 8 years of online market research in IPSOS and another 5 of marketing & comms in IBM. Currently, she's crafting a product for eCommerce in Omniconvert. She finds it difficult to define her current role but some people named her an intrapreneur, so we will go with that. When she's not at work, she likes to get involved in innovation projects and use Design Thinking methodology. She's the happiest puppy on this planet when she gets the chance to talk to people. So user research is her thing. On Sundays, you will find her in Ferentari doing homework with the kids from School no 136.

👩‍💻 Flavia Husar, Communication and Brand manager @ Innovation Labs

📃 Bio:
Responsible for overseeing and coordinating all communication with media, social and community stakeholders. As the CCO she managea the communication and brand strategy, all Innovation Labs official communications and also the social media channels. Also, she supervises new initiatives and plans for the Innovation Labs community and the creation and distribution of all promotion materials, visuals and marketing campaigns that include the Tech Lounge and Innovation Labs brand. Also, she coordinates all events' organising together with the executive team and partners of the program.

***Important Information: By registering you agree to appear in photographic and video material taken at the event and you allow the organizers of Women Techmakers to use this material for future promotional purposes.
events.how_to_find_us: Daca ai drum in Bucuresti, pe 13 Martie, te asteptam la eveniment

events.name: Autumn Event by GDG Pitesti
events.description:
👨🏻‍💻 Sorin Topala | Salesforce Consultant Developer

📌Presentation title:
Salesforce 101

📃 Abstract:
Salesforce is a CRM platform used by everyone from major online retailers to utilities companies to beauty brands. And some of the people in the audience might be Salesforce developers without even knowing it.
Salesforce Consultant Developer

🚀Bio:
Sorin is a Salesforce Consultant Developer in Bucharest currently making sure that people in Germany have gas in their homes. Before that he worked on everything from educational games for children to financial forecasting to beauty product recommendations. He also has an unhealthy obsession with Dragon Ball and all things Google.

👨🏻‍💻 Luca Aurel | Impostor software developer

📌Presentation title:
From monolith to microservices. What went slightly wrong.

📃 Abstract:
The 4 year history of what the speaker thought would be the transition from monolith to microservices. What was wrong. Where are we now. All from the point of view of a software developer.

🚀Bio:
Software development for 19 years. Mostly J2EE backend but he did a lot of other small things. Luca also did CSS in times when you didn't have to learn CSS to know CSS.

events.name: DevFest Bucharest 2019
events.description:
We’re excited to announce DevFest Bucharest 2019!

This is a community-run, one-day conference aimed to bring developers, tech-companies, students and awesome speakers together in one location, so they can learn and share knowledge about established or emerging technologies on topics such as Cloud, Kubernetes, Big Data, Data science, Android, Flutter, Firebase, Mobile Technologies, Google Assistant, Machine Learning, Kotlin and more.

At GDG DevFest Bucharest 2019 our tracks will be: Android & Mobile Technologies, Kotlin/Everywhere and Cloud Technologies.

Read more and grab your tickets on: https://devfest.ro

AGENDA:
9:00 AM Registration & Welcome Coffee
10:00 AM Opening Keynote
10:30 AM Sessions
12:30 PM Lunch time
2:00 PM Sessions
6:30 PM Closing

GDG DevFest Bucharest is a community event, made by the community for the community. The main purpose of this conference is to bring together tech specialists and give to the attendees the possibility to participate in their presentations and ask them questions about their common passions: technology and programming.

events.name: CODVIDHack Challenge 2020
events.description:
Tu poți, printr-o linie de cod, să salvezi vieți. Mii. Poate sute de mii.

Google Developer Group Bucharest susține Challenge Accepted COVIDHack 2020, un eveniment organizat de Școala informală de IT, în parteneriat cu Acceleratorul de Business BCR - InnovX & Google Atelierul Digital, cu scopul de a folosi tehnologia modernă pentru găsirea unor soluții reale care schimbă vieți.

Cum te-ai simți să știi că ideea ta îi poate ajuta pe cei care luptă în prima linie cu pandemia COVID-19? Poți tu, printr-o linie de cod (generic vorbind) să schimbi viața oamenilor care astăzi se confruntă cu grele încercări? Cum ar fi să dăruiești – prin timpul, abilitățile și expertiza ta – șanse reale celor care nu le au? Sunt lucruri despre care poți să vorbești mai puțin, dar pentru care poți să faci mai mult. Poți mai ales acum, când un maraton de codare se dedică exclusiv dorinței de a limita sau chiar înlătura efectele pandemiei COVID-19 asupra vieții oamenilor.

În perioada 8 - 9 - 10 mai, cu pasiune, perseverență și curaj, se deschid noi perspective de proiecte IT care pot avea un impact real și pozitiv în viața oamenilor. Împreună, 20 de echipe formate din 100 de hackeri și 20 de mentori, în doar 48 de ore de codare, vor demonstra că o linie de cod poate face – cu adevărat – lumea un loc mai bun. Anul acesta, provocarea lansată de Școala informală de IT își continuă tradiția prin cea de-a șasea ediție a hackathon-ului care generează schimbări în societate și care are, de data aceasta, un format 100% online.

Ne dorim ca, prin proiectele dezvoltate, să țintim către 3 obiective:
- Salvarea vieților;
- Salvarea sistemului sanitar;
- Salvarea mediului economic;

Dacă reprezinți o instituție, o companie sau un ONG, înscrie în competiție problema/nevoia cu care te confrunți în această perioadă, a pandemiei COVID-19: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdvTUD-48s7SftfGUUCzAmeRJTQ_IFQlydwjgjz7mfXwdy4Ig/viewform

Dacă ai cunoștințe în programare, testare, analiză de business sau în altă arie a IT-ului, înscrie-te la maratonul de codare, și contribuie la dezvoltarea soluțiilor software: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdAnIo8es39fT9gWKNiyTEXv2vQCkEJCyZ1K0tnWXW1lwHNuw/viewform

Dacă ești senior în IT și ai experiență în coordonarea echipelor, înscrie-te ca mentor pentru una din echipele multidisciplinare de la Challenge Accepted: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdvTUD-48s7SftfGUUCzAmeRJTQ_IFQlydwjgjz7mfXwdy4Ig/viewform
